title: [Large-scale] Problem-based Learning and Simulation Education to Strengthen Pediatric Cardiology Diagnostic and Treatment Competencies

context.prior_knowledge: Elementary cardiology and pediatric clinical knowledge
context.additional_context: Practical education centered on clinical simulation equipment and problem-based learning materials.

learning_goals: Establish differential diagnoses and treatment plans by analyzing various pediatric cardiac disease cases
Improve emergency response capabilities for pediatric cardiac conditions in clinical simulation environments

Graduate students will collaborate in multidisciplinary teams (four members) on three problem-based learning (PBL) scenarios (e.g., climate change response, medical AI development, sustainable energy design) over three weeks. They will write two weekly meeting logs (summaries, role assignments, decisions) and submit a 15-minute PPT with 5-minute Q&A that meets at least four of five rubric criteria (clarity, logic, creativity, teamwork, visual effectiveness).
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
